page.title: 16MARKETS IN CIRENCESTER
page.content:
There are 3 markets in Cirencester. One of them is the{Cattle Market}and the other two are{General Markets, consisting of various stalls selling vegetables,clothes,cakes cheese, shoes,baskets, jeans and snacks.To hire an 8 ft stall costs Â£11 a day.The council run the market and they assemble and dismantle the stalls.
The{Cattle Market}on a Tuesday sells cows, sheep, goats, bulls and calves and is run by auctioneers.The cattle are 2 years old, weigh 500 kg and are worth Â£560. The sheep are 10 to 20 weeks old and worth Â£35 to Â£40. When sold, a hole is punched in their ears and a different colour painted on their backs so that the farmers know which they own. THe farmers travel up to 10 or 20 miles to get to market.
